title: (x) Green & Spring package design by Pearlfisher - FF Scala Sans, Georgia, Stempel Garamond {Yves}
content:
Can anyone ID the fonts -- both serif and sans serif -- used in this beautiful package design for Green & Spring by Pearlfisher?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202080815im_/http:/typophile.com/files/154_766_6309.jpg)
author: DesignGuyMemphis

comments.content: The sans is [FF Scala Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202080815/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/super_families/ff_scala/); the serif frankly is too small to allow for a conclusive identification, but it might be Georgia.
Looks like the grey serif face is different from the bold italic, most probably a Garamond.
I'm pretty sure it's [Stempel Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202080815/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/garamond/), but I'll need a larger sample of that grey serif face.

Thanks a million. I actually own Scala Sans and somehow missed it when looking through my font library. I too thought Georgia and hadn't considered that the bold italic and regular italic were different fonts. Many thanks for your help.
